DataElement.preferredName: Nutrition Automatic Self-Administered 24 hours Dietary Assessment Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The taking in and use of food and other nourishing material by the body.  Nutrition is a 3-part process.  First, food or drink is consumed.  Second, the body breaks down the food or drink into nutrients.  Third, the nutrients travel through the bloodstream to different parts of the body where they are used as "fuel" and for many other purposes.  To give the body proper nutrition, a person has to eat and drink enough of the foods that contain key nutrients._Operating with minimal human intervention; independent of external control._Self given or applied._Vo value exists._Regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person or animal. This does not include DIET THERAPY, a specific diet prescribed in the treatment of a disease._A removal or correction of a marketed product that the FDA considers to be in violation of the laws it administers and against which the agency would initiate legal action, such as seizure. A recall may be a voluntary action conducted by the manufacturer, by FDA request, or by FDA order under statutory authority._A set of questions or items shown to a respondent in order to get answers for research purposes. [PRO Draft Guidance] See also instrument, survey._A measurement, evaluation, or judgment for a study variable pertaining to the status of a subject. NOTE: Assessments are usually measured at a certain time, and usually are not compounded significantly by combining several simultaneous measurements to form a derived assessment (e.g., BMI) or a result of statistical analysis. The term assessment is intended to invoke some degree of evaluation or judgment concerning subject status. Refer to COA glossary of terms. See also variable, outcome, endpoint. [After Clinical Outcome Assessment (COA) Glossary of Terms FDA FDA eCOA Glossary]_a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

NOTE: Assessments are usually measured at a certain time, and usually are not compounded significantly by combining several simultaneous measurements to form a derived assessment (e.g., BMI) or a result of statistical analysis. The term assessment is intended to invoke some degree of evaluation or judgment concerning subject status. Refer to COA glossary of terms. See also variable, outcome, endpoint. ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The taking in and use of food and other nourishing material by the body.  Nutrition is a 3-part process.  First, food or drink is consumed.  Second, the body breaks down the food or drink into nutrients.  Third, the nutrients travel through the bloodstream to different parts of the body where they are used as "fuel" and for many other purposes.  To give the body proper nutrition, a person has to eat and drink enough of the foods that contain key nutrients.

Concepts.definition: That which is consumed to fuel necessary life processes of an organism.

Property.preferredName: Automatic Self-Administered 24 hours Diet Assessment Questionnaire
Property.preferredDefinition: Operating with minimal human intervention; independent of external control.:Self given or applied.:Vo value exists.:The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:A predetermined set of questions.

Concepts.definition: Operating with minimal human intervention; independent of external control.

The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: The Automated Self-Administer
ReferenceDocuments.description: The Automated Self-Administered 24-Hour Dietary Assessment Tool consists of an initial quick list, where the respondent reports all the foods and beverages consumed during the day by eating occasion.
